original_text:
I believe culture should be taught as a subject in South Africa. Because if we, as white South Africans, don't understand or respect black cultureâ€”and vice versaâ€”how can we truly build a united nation?
Why aren't we learning to speak Xhosa, Sotho, Zulu, and other indigenous languages? These are not just languages; they are doorways to understanding, to healing, and to pride in our shared heritage.
Letâ€™s be real: division helps the system stay broken. But weâ€™re smarter than that.
Itâ€™s time we stop letting our government and history divide us. Letâ€™s show the world that South Africans can rise above, that we are stronger togetherâ€”proud of every culture, and united as one nation.
translated_text:
I believe culture should be taught as a subject in South Africa. Because if we, as white South Africans, don't understand or respect black cultureand vice versahow can we truly build a united nation?
Why aren't we learning to speak Xhosa, Sotho, Zulu, and other indigenous languages? These are not just languages; they are doorways to understanding, to healing, and to pride in our shared heritage.
Lets be real: division helps the system stay broken. But were smarter than that.
Its time we stop letting our government and history divide us. Lets show the world that South Africans can rise above, that we are stronger togetherproud of every culture, and united as one nation.
